Description: Largely intact, perhaps Attic, black-glazed pottery cup-kotyle. Heavy offset lip, low pedestal foot; handles horizontal. Blotchy glaze. Glazed save for underside, which has three rings and a band around.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
In pencil on underside of foot '601'.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 132, no. 371, pl. XXXIX)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 236, no. 227)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1523)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5714 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
